frame.name: Losing_it
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Protagonist</fen> goes from a default state of mental and emotional equilibrium into a temporary state of disequilibrium, often a state of anger. A <fen>Reason</fen> for the change of state may be given. Likewise, <fen>Action</fen>s that the Experiencer takes as a result of their new emotional state may be expressed. Both <fen>Reason</fen>s and <fen>Action</fen>s may be introduced just as coordinated clauses. The lexical units also are frequently accompanied by expressions of an <fen>Affected_party</fen>. This frame is populated by many lexical units that are based on the emotion-heat/pressure metaphor. Note also that many phrases with equivalent meaning to targets of this frame are compositional, e.g. 'go insane', which we treat as the LU insane.a (of the Mental_property frame) plus the inchoative support go.v.
<ex><fex name="Protagonist">You</fex> <fex name="Degree">totally</fex> <t>flipped</t> <t>out</t> <fex name="Affected_party">on our waiter</fex> <fex name="Reason">because of the mix-up with the bill</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Protagonist
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the person (or people) whose mental state changes.
<ex><fex name="Protagonist">Kim</fex> <t>went</t> <t>ballistic</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Action
FE.definition:
<def-root>Something done by the <fen>Protagonist</fen> as a result of losing mental equilibrium.
<ex>You totally <t>lost</t> <t>it</t> <fex name="act">with that speech you just gave to the Principal</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Degree</fen> marks the extent to which the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s mental state changes.
<ex>John <fex name="Degree">totally</fex> <t>lost</t> <t>it</t></ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, especially general descriptions comparing events.
<ex>He <t>flipped</t> <t>out</t> <fex name="Manner">like my dad did last year</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Affected_party
FE.definition: <def-root>A person (or persons) who is saliently affected by the <fen>Protagonist</fen> 's <fen>Action</fen>s. <ex>I'm sorry, but every time I try to sneak out she <t>goes</t> <t>apeshit</t> <fex name="Aff_par">on me</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The cause for the <fen>Protagonist</fen> to go crazy.
<ex>She <t>went</t> <t>ballistic</t> <fex name="exp">because of the pizzas</fex>, man.</ex></def-root>
